                                                Vehicle Engineering
overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Vehicle Electronics, Network Infrastructure, Vehicle Engineering, Battery Technology, Driver Assistance Systems, Electromobility

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Starts in winter semester 2017/18! The innovation of future vehicle generations is determined by the further development of electronic systems. Driver assistance systems, intelligent lighting or autonomous driving are not conceivable without electronic systems and intelligent sensors. Due to increasing economic efficiency, vehicles with electric or hybrid drives will increasingly push back the classic combustion engines. The practice-oriented Automobile Electronics and Electromobility course teaches students to develop electronic systems for vehicles. They deal with innovative topics like alternative drive technology, lithium batteries or fuel cells, power electronics, intelligent sensors and Communication Systems.

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The Automotive Production degree course aims to enable young people to design and optimise production processes for the automotive manufacturers and parts supply industries. Students complete a Mechanical Engineering course designed to match the practical requirements of the automotive industry. Training is augmented by field trips and a 20-week compulsory work placement at a company in the automotive or automotive parts supplier sector, to strengthen practical relevance. Modular degree course. Applications may be possible after the deadlines if degree courses still have excess capacity. If you are interested, please enquire by telephone on +49 (0)375/5361184 or +49 (0)375/5361180.

Das Electronics gehört zum Studienbereiche Electrical Engineering der Fächergruppe Engineering Sciences.Weitere Informationen zum Studienbereich Electrical Engineering.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Engineering Sciences.
                                                Electronics
overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Principles of Vehicle Engineering, Basic Principles of the Chassis and Vehicle Drive, Automotive Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Electrical Drives for Motor Vehicles, Microcontrollers and Signal Processors for Motor Vehicles, Circuit Design and Simulation, Vehicle Communication Systems, Modelling and Simulation, Actuator Technology/Power Electronics, Electromagnetic Compatibility

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Innovation in motor vehicles today is driven mainly by automotive electronics. While the electronic control system for drive and suspension systems was introduced several years ago, current trends involve driver assistance systems, electronically controlled steering systems and message systems as well as the “Bluetooth” link between the mobile phone and the vehicle or communication between vehicles via WiFi.Modern motor vehicles today comprise over 100 electrical and electronic components that need to be linked to each other in an intelligent manner. On the one hand, reliability plays an important role under extreme environmental conditions such as heat, moisture, mechanical vibrations and electromagnetic radiation, and on the other hand the functionality of the systems. Therefore, you will also acquire special knowledge about chassis behaviour, modern electrical drive concepts and intelligent energy storage systems during your studies.

overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Motor Vehicles and Mechatronics, Maintenance and Accident Analysis, Internal Combustion Engines and Drive Technology, Body Development and Construction

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: In the degree course in Automotive Engineering, you deal with the planning, development and construction of vehicles. In addition to the design of new vehicle concepts, this also includes the development of modern bodies or testing with modern test benches and simulation tools.As a basis for this, you will deal with the interaction of individual vehicle components such as the drive, body and electronics. The properties and effects of different materials used in the vehicle also play an important role. You will get to know them better, for example, in the field of materials science. Beyond the technical details, you should of course keep an eye on functional criteria such as economy or safety when developing vehicles. The degree course in Automotive Engineering also prepares you for this.Thanks to the practical training, after completion, you have a variety of perspectives, especially in the development, manufacture and maintenance of motor vehicles.
